item.content:encoded: Saudi Arabia’s new domestic abuse law (reported by Al Jazeera and thoughtfully commented on at Tabsir), the result of the No More Abuse campaign, is noteworthy in several respects. To pick just one, in such adjustments to positive law in Islamic societies wherein Sharia regulations are “improved,” “modernized,” and/or sidestepped, is this the result of classical natural-law-style conceptions of justice prevailing over outmoded formulations of divine law; or, is this simply the inevitable march of modern Enlightenment poking its toes into the Kingdom’s waters?
